## What the paper finds ... {.smaller}

 

 

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
 

$PV = f(\text{Bank Presence})$
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
 

However, this relation varies across the different types of banks and is particularly pronounced for locally rooted banks with a mandate to promote the regional economy.
:::
:::

## Great paper {.smaller}

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
 

What I like

-   Interesting results.
-   Data used.
-   Results are sensible, novel.

I missed effects of

-   locals pressuring banks to adjust lending standards [see @Vins2008; @CalomirisHaber2014].
-   geography (hills) and meteorology. Will demand for PV be the same in all parts of Germany?
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
